EXSLTExslNode-set.summary: exsl:node-set() returns a node-set from a result tree fragment, which is what you get when you look at the xsl:variable instead of its select attribute to fetch a variable's value. This lets you process the XML created within a variable to process it in multiple steps.

remarks.para: You can also use exsl:node-set() to turn strings into text nodes.

EXSLTExslNode-set.returns: The node-set corresponding to the specified object.
